key_facts: The Black Parade is a concept album detailing the story of 'The Patient', a man dying of cancer who reflects on his life as death comes for him in the form of his fondest memory: a parade.
The album was released in October 2006, a period when alternative and emo culture was at its peak, and represented a significant stylistic evolution for My Chemical Romance.
The album was written and demoed in the reportedly haunted Paramore Mansion, which significantly influenced the record's dark and theatrical atmosphere.
The band adopted an alter-ego for the album, also called 'The Black Parade', to distance themselves from their previous work and fully embody the new sound.
Major musical influences for the album included theatrical glam rock artists of the 70s and 80s, particularly Queen and David Bowie, as well as Pink Floyd for conceptual elements.
